revised_title: A New Pachypleurosaur Species from the Middle Triassic of Monte San Giorgio, Switzerland
tldr: The author describes a new pachypleurosaur species, Serpianosaurus mirigiolensis, found in the Middle Triassic 'Grenzbitumen'-horizon of Monte San Giorgio, Switzerland. The species is characterized by its relatively large skull and straight lower jaw. The author provides a detailed morphological description and a quantitative analysis, discussing its phylogenetic relationships and the status of the Pachypleurosauridae within the Sauropterygia.
